solution_line_template: Two boxes of crayons have {crayons_per_box} x {unused_fraction_first_two_boxes} = <<{crayons_per_box}*{unused_fraction_first_two_boxes}={unused_crayons_per_box_first_two}>>{unused_crayons_per_box_first_two} unused crayons from each box.

So, a total of {unused_crayons_per_box_first_two} x {num_boxes_first_set} = <<{unused_crayons_per_box_first_two}*{num_boxes_first_set}={total_unused_crayons_first_two_boxes}>>{total_unused_crayons_first_two_boxes} unused crayons are in the two boxes.

For the other 2 boxes, there are {crayons_per_box} x {used_fraction_other_two_boxes} = <<{crayons_per_box}*{used_fraction_other_two_boxes}={used_crayons_per_box_other_two}>>{used_crayons_per_box_other_two} used crayons from each box.

So, a total of {unused_crayons_per_box_other_two} x {num_boxes_other_set} = <<{unused_crayons_per_box_other_two}*{num_boxes_other_set}={total_unused_crayons_other_two_boxes}>>{total_unused_crayons_other_two_boxes} unused crayons are in the other two boxes.

Therefore, Madeline has a total of {total_unused_crayons_first_two_boxes} + {total_unused_crayons_other_two_boxes} + {unused_crayons_last_box} = <<{total_unused_crayons_first_two_boxes}+{total_unused_crayons_other_two_boxes}+{unused_crayons_last_box}={total_unused_crayons}>>{total_unused_crayons} unused crayons.
